snippet: The Red Hot Chili Peppers' lead vocalist has a broken foot.
abstract: The Red Hot Chili Peppers' lead vocalist has a broken foot.
lead_paragraph: The Red Hot Chili Peppers have postponed the start of their tour this year until late March because Anthony Kiedis, the group's lead vocalist, has undergone surgery to repair a broken foot, according to the band's Web site. The cause of the injury has not been made public, but surgeons operated on Mr. Kiedis's right foot to remove a crushed sesamoid bone - a small bone in the ball of the foot at the base of the big toe -- and to reattach a flexor tendon, the statement said. The 49-year-old front man is expected to recover fully.

headline.main: Red Hot Chili Peppers Delay Tour After  Kiedis Has Surgery
